img_text: In 1991, Sammy Wilson, referring to the loyalist murder n Co. Doneg of SF member Eddie Fullerton, and t thekilling of SF councillor Bernard O'Hagan in Co. Tyrone, asked Belfast City Council if it would "congratulate all those who have done a good job on both sides of the border". Mr. Wilson also called SF voters "sub human animals" and said that wha was needed was a policy of extermination".
